=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/10/05 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Dexter Fletcher'], 'Producers': ['Matthew Vaughn', 'David Furnish', 'Adam Bohling', 'David Reid', 'Elton John', 'Claudia Vaughn', 'Brian Oliver', 'Steve Hamilton Shaw', 'Michael Gracey'], 'Starring': ['Taron Egerton', 'Jamie Bell', 'Richard Madden']} Review Text: First off, I have a lot of downloaded Elton John music. Having said that, this movie was a terrible musical. I want my money back. I hated it from the very opening scene. I struggled and fast forwarded over half way through and still the same.

I want my $5 back. Review Title: Great Musician.....Terrible musical.....I hated it Rating: 1.0 --------------------------------------------------

Keanu Comedy, Action, Intense, Fun ['Cousins hatch a plot to retrieve a stolen cat by posing as drug dealers for a street gang.'] {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Peter Atencio'], 'Producers': ['Keegan-Michael Key', 'Jordan Peele', 'Peter Principato', 'Paul Young', 'Joel Zadak'], 'Starring': ['Jordan Peele', 'Keegan-Michael Key', 'Tiffany Haddish']} it had a few funny scenes but I could only suffer through 30-40mins till I got bored and started washing clothes instead. I like the main actors. I would like to see them in a better movie. Kinda funny but lost interest less than half way through.... {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['J Blakeson'], 'Producers': ['Tobey Maguire'], 'Starring': ['Chloë Grace Moretz', 'Nick Robinson', 'Ron Livingston'], 'Studio': ['Columbia Pictures']} Just terrible....and cheesy. Abrams'], 'Producers': ['Kathleen Kennedy', 'J.J. Abrams', 'Bryan Burk'], 'Starring': ['Harrison Ford', 'Mark Hamill', 'Carrie Fisher'], 'Studio': ['Lucasfilm']} Great. I want the force so I can fetch drinks and food while I rewatch. Awesome nice franchise for episode 7. {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Richard Schenkman'], 'Producers': ['Richard Schenkman', 'Eric D. Wilkinso'], 'Starring': ['David Lee Smith', 'Sterling Knight', 'Michael Dorn'], 'Studio': ['WowNow Entertainment']} This was a VERY disappointing sequel to the original which was an awesome plot/story that was riveting.

Don't ruin your memory from the original and pretend this turd doesn't exist. I agree with most of everybody else Shazam! Fantasy, Comedy, Exciting, Sweet ['Billy Batson is a streetwise 14-year-old who can magically transform into the adult superhero Shazam simply by shouting out one word. His newfound powers soon get put to the test when he squares off against the evil Dr. Thaddeus Sivana.'] {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['David Sandberg'], 'Producers': ['Peter Safran'], 'Starring': ['Zachary Levi', 'Asher Angel', 'Mark Strong']} I'm not going to write a long explanation.

It's a good story, likable characters, lots of humor with a splash of seriousness and a decent bad guy. profile:
**User Summary Update:**

- **Genre Preference:** The user continues to favor comedy, especially when mixed with fantasy elements. However, their recent interaction indicates a strong critical stance against musicals that do not meet their expectations for quality storytelling, suggesting a nuanced preference within the genre.

- **Engagement Level:** Despite a recent positive trend towards complete series, the user shows a stark contrast in their latest review, emphasizing their willingness to engage with various formats while also expressing disappointment when the content fails to resonate.

- **Actor Appreciation:** The user remains supportive of well-known actors but demonstrates that their appreciation can waver when the overall execution of a project does not align with their narrative standards.

- **Review Disposition:** The user maintains a critical eye, as evidenced by their harsh review of a musical they found lacking. This indicates that while they enjoy fantasy and humor, they have little tolerance for perceived poor quality in storytelling.

- **Tolerance for Content:** Their tolerance for content remains cautious, and this latest review reaffirms their preference for coherent narratives over indulgent or excessive elements, even within genres typically rich in such aspects.

- **Overall Trend:** The user actively seeks high-quality narratives, but their recent experience reveals a clear need for consistency in quality across all types of media. This feedback suggests a discerning viewer whose expectations remain high despite a willingness to explore diverse content.
